vulnerability.name: Cross site scripting vulnerability
vulnerability.description: Cross Site Scripting was found at: "https://satoffice043:8443/wavsep/active/SInjection-Detection-Evaluation-GET-200Error/Case19-InjectionInUpdate-NumericWithoutQuotes-CommandInjection-With200Errors.jsp", using HTTP method GET. The sent data was: "msgid=%3CScRIPT%3Ea%3D%2F81yI%2F%0Afake_alert%28a.source%29%3C%2FSCRiPT%3E". This vulnerability affects ALL browsers. This vulnerability was found in the request with id 1747.

httpresponse.body:
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">
<html>
<head>
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1">
<title>Case 19 - Injection into numeric values in an update page with erroneous responses and quote validation</title>
</head>
<body>
Exception details: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near '=<ScRIPT>a=/81yI/ fake_alert(a.source)</SCRiPT>' at line 1
</body>
</html>
